elements.title: Buford Dam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Buford Dam (pictured) is maintained in part by a "Chew Crew" of sixteen goats?

elements.title: Joseph-Alexandre Baile (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joseph-Alexandre Baile argued against the separation of the parish of Notre-Dame in Montreal, declaring it to be against civil law?

elements.title: Retina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that by switching to the smaller typeface Retina in the stock listings of their newspaper, The Wall Street Journal was able to save $6 to 7 million annually?

elements.title: adapt Sailor Moon into a Western live-action series (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there were two failed attempts to adapt Sailor Moon into a Western live-action series?

elements.title: Brizlincote (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brizlincote in Burton upon Trent, England, was formerly known as "Little Switzerland" for its charm and recreational use by locals?

elements.title: Archie C. Kuntze (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Captain Archie C. Kuntze, known as the "American Mayor of Saigon", was court-martialled for living "openly and notoriously in his official quarters" with his Taiwanese girlfriend?

elements.title: siege of Wark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite a truce, the siege of Wark continued?

elements.title: the Century (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a conversion plan led to the "Battle of the Century"?
